abstract: Barclays’ chief executive John Varley has flown against the popular opinion of international banking by declaring the proposals of the Basel III committee — due to be signed off by the G20 next month — as fair, in an interview with The Financial Times.
snippet: Barclays’ chief executive John Varley has flown against the popular opinion of international banking by declaring the proposals of the Basel III committee — due to be signed off by the G20 next month — as fair, in an interview with The Financial T...
lead_paragraph: Barclays‘s chief executive, John Varley, in an interview with The Financial Times, has flown against popular opinion in banking circles by declaring that the proposals of the Basel III committee — expected to be adopted by the Group of 20 nations next month — are fair.

headline.main: Barclays Chief Says Basel III Is Fair
